content.question: NO CALCULATOR IS ALLOWED FOR THIS QUESTION. Show all of your work, even though the question may not explicitly remind you to do so. Clearly label any functions, graphs, tables, or other objects that you use. Justifications require that you give mathematical reasons, and that you verify the needed conditions under which relevant theorems, properties, definitions, or tests are applied. Your work will be scored on the correctness and completeness of your methods as well as your answers. Answers without supporting work will usually not receive credit. Unless otherwise specified, answers (numeric or algebraic) need not be simplified. If your answer is given as a decimal approximation, it should be correct to three places after the decimal point. Unless otherwise specified, the domain of a function <math alttext="f"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> is assumed to be the set of all real numbers <math alttext="x"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> for which <math alttext="f of x"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> is a real number. A particle moves along the <math alttext="y"><mstyle><mrow><mi>y</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>-axis so that its position at time <math alttext="t"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> is given by <math alttext="y of t equals, t squared, times the tangent of, open parenthesis, 1 over t, close parenthesis "><mstyle><mrow><mi>y</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><msup><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mi>tan</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mrow><mo>(</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow></mfrac><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> for <math alttext="t greater than 1"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi><mo>></mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>. (a) Show that the velocity of the particle at time <math alttext="t"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> is given by <math alttext="v of t equals, 2 t times the tangent of, open parenthesis, 1 over t, close parenthesis, minus the secant squared of, open parenthesis, 1 over t, close parenthesis "><mstyle><mrow><mi>v</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mn>2</mn><mi>t</mi><mi>tan</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mrow><mo>(</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow></mfrac><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>−</mo><msup><mrow><mi>sec</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mo>⁡</mo><mrow><mo>(</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow></mfrac><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> for <math alttext="t greater than 1"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi><mo>></mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>.

frqParts.text: NO CALCULATOR IS ALLOWED FOR THIS QUESTION. Show all of your work, even though the question may not explicitly remind you to do so. Clearly label any functions, graphs, tables, or other objects that you use. Justifications require that you give mathematical reasons, and that you verify the needed conditions under which relevant theorems, properties, definitions, or tests are applied. Your work will be scored on the correctness and completeness of your methods as well as your answers. Answers without supporting work will usually not receive credit. Unless otherwise specified, answers (numeric or algebraic) need not be simplified. If your answer is given as a decimal approximation, it should be correct to three places after the decimal point. Unless otherwise specified, the domain of a function <math alttext="f"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> is assumed to be the set of all real numbers <math alttext="x"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> for which <math alttext="f of x"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> is a real number. A particle moves along the <math alttext="y"><mstyle><mrow><mi>y</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>-axis so that its position at time <math alttext="t"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> is given by <math alttext="y of t equals, t squared, times the tangent of, open parenthesis, 1 over t, close parenthesis "><mstyle><mrow><mi>y</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><msup><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mi>tan</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mrow><mo>(</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow></mfrac><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> for <math alttext="t greater than 1"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi><mo>></mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>. (a) Show that the velocity of the particle at time <math alttext="t"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> is given by <math alttext="v of t equals, 2 t times the tangent of, open parenthesis, 1 over t, close parenthesis, minus the secant squared of, open parenthesis, 1 over t, close parenthesis "><mstyle><mrow><mi>v</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mn>2</mn><mi>t</mi><mi>tan</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mrow><mo>(</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow></mfrac><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>−</mo><msup><mrow><mi>sec</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mo>⁡</mo><mrow><mo>(</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow></mfrac><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> for <math alttext="t greater than 1"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi><mo>></mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>.

(b) At time <math alttext="t equals, 4 over pi"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow><mrow><mi>π</mi></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math>, is the particle moving toward the origin or away from the origin? Give a reason for your answer.

(c) The velocity of the particle at time <math alttext="t"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> can be written as <math alttext="v of t equals, the fraction with numerator 2 times the tangent of, open parenthesis, 1 over t, close parenthesis, and denominator 1 over t, end fraction, minus the secant squared of, open parenthesis, 1 over t, close parenthesis "><mstyle><mrow><mi>v</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>2</mn><mi>tan</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mrow><mo>(</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow></mfrac><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mfrac><mo>−</mo><msup><mrow><mi>sec</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mo>⁡</mo><mrow><mo>(</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow></mfrac><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> for <math alttext="t greater than 1"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi><mo>></mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>.Find <math alttext="the limit as t approaches infinity, of, v of t"><mstyle><mrow><munder><mrow><mi>lim</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>t</mi><mo>→</mo><mi>∞</mi></mrow></munder><mi>v</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>. Show the work that leads to your answer.

topic.text: 4.2: Straight-Line Motion - Connecting Position, Velocity, and Acceleration

skill.text: Skill 1.E: Apply appropriate mathematical rules or procedures, with and without technology.
